file_content.text: It started with just a few soldiers, this whole thing. Quietly acting as one, no hesitation. It's unsettling.
I know Agent Shan doesn't like to place his people in harm's way. What's happened to the Sixth Line--it must be eating him up inside.
Minister Beniko has been a smart boss. Capable. This has to be pushing her to her limits.
I'd hate to be one of them. No control, helpless. Guess I should thank my implants.
Vitiate's pawns have control of the perimeter defenses. They're shooting anything that moves, bombarding civilian centers.
We have to cut the defenses' power.
Saresh has her forces all over New Adasta. Some of them are possessed now. Made a real mess.
Are you talking about her now, or you?
Let's keep on target. Doesn't matter how bad things get. We have to put an end to Vitiate's plan.
This is Lana. Agent Kovach may have been hurt, possibly worse. I haven't heard from him, and his tracker's off.
You should know Theron Shan is here.
Thought you'd like to know--Theron's alive.
Yes, I'm aware.
The last I heard from Agent Kovach, he had a plan involving the city's electrical grid. I'll steer you to where he might have gone.
Okay, I've placed the dampeners on manual. I'll be controlling them while you alter the makeup of the grid.
Once it's all set, we'll put a shock into every living thing in New Adasta. Then we'll figure out what's next.
That's one down. I've got you covered.
Finally heard from Agent Kovach. He says you're working together on a solution.
More and more of our forces have fallen to Vitiate. It's spreading beyond the city now, along with the war. There must be an end to this.
Excuse me. My attention is needed elsewhere. Everywhere.
No, the other one. The other one!
Sorry. Master Surro took down a squad trying to evac slaves. Then turned on the slaves.
Running triage on the survivors. I just wanted to, uh.... Just--good luck, okay?
Maybe you don't want to hear this. I have to say it, though.
I respect Lana Beniko--sincerely. But the Empire enslaves and slaughters innocent people every day, and I respect common decency more.
Theron's a good man. It matters that he placed his trust in me. But I work for the Republic. That's the job.
Okay, that's enough. Any more and it's the dampeners that will take the brunt of the surge.
All that's left is to disable the system failsafe.
Before we go ahead with this, you and I should talk--in person. I'll see you shortly.
Theron's alive.
Hey. That was... awkward. Not as bad as my previous chat with her, believe it or not.
Look, my team--my Jedi--more than anyone here, they're my responsibility.
Look, I know killing Jedi is kind of a thing for you, but the Sixth Line.... It's because of me they're here in the first place.
Look, I know saving the lives of Jedi isn't high on your priority list. The Sixth Line, though--they're here because of me.
If you could find some way--any way at all--just... please, help them. Don't do the other thing.
I've got some unexpected power loss going on here. I know you're a little busy, but there's no way I can get there and back in time.
I just ended a holocall with Darth Marr. He would like very much to speak with you.
Hey, managed to get through to Saresh. Couldn't get her to budge on the withdrawal idea, but maybe you can sway her. She wants to talk to you anyway.
I'm supposed to tell you Saresh wants to talk to you.
I hope you understand.
